title: Cat. 4  Caudle Cup, c. 1690
publication_title: American Silver in the Art Institute of Chicago
content:
<section class="osci-tk-epub-section tombstone" id="tombstone">Jeremiah Dummer (American, 1645–1718)  
Boston, Massachusetts  
Silver; 7.6 × 15.2 × 7.6 cm (3 1/4 × 6 1/2 × 3 1/2 in.)  
The Art Institute of Chicago, restricted gift of the Antiquarian Society through the Mr. and Mrs. Edwin A. Seipp Fund, 1952.167

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section curatorial_entry" id="curatorial_entry">On side (fig. 4.1)

Engraved on side in script: MJ / to / AFA

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section provenance" id="provenance">Hermann F. Clarke; with Ginsburg and Levy, Inc., New York, by 1952.

Sold to the Art Institute of Chicago, 1952.

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section exhibitions" id="exhibitions">Art Institute of Chicago, The Antiquarian Society: The First One Hundred Years, April 23–June 19, 1977, p. 143, cat. 169.

Art Institute of Chicago, Art and Appetite: American Painting, Culture, and Cuisine, November 1, 2013–January 27, 2014, p. 109 (ill.); Amon Carter Museum of American Art, Fort Worth, TX, February 22–May 18, 2014.

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section references" id="references">Clarke and Foote (1970), p. 139, cat. 32 (appendix).

Hanks (1970), pp. 418–22, 418 (ill.).

Tvrdik (1977), p. 143, cat. 169.

Kane et al. (1998), p. 391.

Barter et al. (2013), p. 109 (ill.).

</section><section id="figures">Caudle Cup, c. 1690.

fig. 4.1 </section>
